thought the world was getting better and everybody have these fanciful notions of heroism behavior and we are going to go off to fight the hand and to defend what is right and probably and probably we did that in world war one that's i mean it's great now but the point is all of those noble feelings they died in the trenches along with all of those boys it was a horrible wars bad as anything ever was and kind of quietly after world war one everybody's like dang i thought all of our technology would make us like each other more and we'd use it to maybe make like jetpacks and flying rose gardens and stuff but it seems like instead the just were making like chemicals that can burn people's lungs from the inside out and guns that fire bullets even more faster than the guns we used to have i'm not sure this is going to work out well then enter warren g-hearting is like a you know what about for me is a vote for return to normalcy and i think he meant normality but you know politicians make a house i make a whatever so kind of hung on him a little bit sort of a joke he's the normal see guy and normalcy turns out to mean i just forget what happened in the trenches and europe and let's have the ladies cut their hair short and where the addresses that by today's standards are unbelievably modest but back then we're super racy and let's have him shake their hips and do the provocative charleston dances well all drink illegal beer and we'll just forget there was ever a world war one and everything will be great forever that was the hardening administration that's what you saw well hardening was the same way so rather than hiring competent people he's like i'm a good old boy i'm a higher the good old boys and bring my buddies from school smoking jackets and will laugh about things that are appropriate to laugh about instead of governing so brings them all in they do just that none of not to do any of the stuff i don't think that they're actually appointed to do in the cabinet but what they do know how to do is to use their proximity to power to make themselves unbelievably rich while they are in office have you ever looked at the numbers of how much richer are representatives at the national level and are centers at the national level become after they gain office it's i don't know where the money comes from it is kind of materializes they bet right on all the stocks all of a sudden it's like they know where everything's going in advance it's just absolutely uncanny how they all become rich well at any rate one of hardening's guys the secretary of the interior albert fall he cooks up some no-bid contract deal to lease out some navy oil reserves in rural Wyoming up by where i used to live to some of his buddies who have an oil company and they give him massive kickbacks under the table and albert fall becomes rich and hardings got a lady on the side in the white house and maybe a love child and so he's distracted and then he finds out about it from a journalist and hardening shoots off his mouth about his darned friends and how they're yet get him over a barrel get him in trouble and then hardening i think he goes on a boat cruise right up to elaska that's right and he took his surgeon general along with them and he had some kind of health event up there but his surgeon general if i recall correctly he they didn't really know how to surgeon or general or anything at all he was some guy that that drinking buddy or something and so the surgeon general botched whatever care he delivered to hardening i think i think hardening just died on that boat trip is pretty much the biggest scandal in the you know like a hundred years and then you got nixon and all that stuff and now they're just so many scandals you can keep track of them and stuff is uh... in need of reform to put it lightly i mean it's kind of funny right that this scandal i'm telling you about from a hundred years ago is alarming because now probably most of your like what that would be that be great if that were the worst scandal that happened in a year in our country or this other country we live whatever i don't know times have changed and you will notice that i picked an example from a hundred years ago once again because i want any of you who still believe that your teams like you and care about you are like a wait a minute what you criticize my team for doing that what about the other team no it's just look my friends politicians just get rich when they get power it just happens all the time fact of life it's not new it's been going on forever and i'm sure it has to do with the ability to control the narrative and control the army and to control everything and so in the ancient world with guys like heyman who were reading about an ester chapter three they said unbelievable access to power and no democratic public accountability whatsoever and the way they would get rich is they would work their way into the trust of the king and then what they would be granted a governorship that's a really good thing in the roman empire julia cesar really came into prominence when he finally landed that governorship once he had gall he was a really big deal not gall like the attribute but gall like france he became a really big deal unbelievably rich why whether you're talking about roamer you're talking about perja if you get a governorship you can let me taxes you can also carry out judgment against people who were accused so if somebody gets a little too up at the end there super rich well i just yeah i have them run afoul of the law find them guilty and then for the good of the realm just confiscate all of their stuff there are all kinds of ways to get rich and there's nothing anybody could do about it so the thing to do is put your head down and hope that the nobleman either comes to favor you is one of his stool pigeons or that he just doesn't notice you and he takes it out on somebody else so no doubt by the time we get to ester chapter three haman is loaded crazy rich and that is made evident by the amount of money that he is going to offer to just throw into the royal treasury of xerxes if xerxes will let him just off a people group without really asking any questions or following up on it and well it goes like this we read yesterday we're going to read again ester three verse six then haman said to king xerxes hey there's certain people dispersed and scattered among the peoples in all the provinces of your kingdom whose customs are different from those of all the other people and who don't obey the king's laws it is not in the king's best interest to tolerate them so if it places the king let a decree be issued to destroy them and i'll put ten thousand pounds of silver in the royal treasury for the men who carry out the business so the king took his signet ring from his finger and gave it to haman son of the meadow the agogite the enemy of the jews and keep the money the king said to haman and do what the people as you please wow that was easy but it's interesting isn't it that haman isn't sure he can win the argument simply on they're bad they might be a threat i really really promise i've been right about other things before when i held lesser positions so on my word you should probably just kill him so when he's given the whole little speech that he's no doubt gone over a hundred times in his head no doubt he saved it for a time when xerxes would be in a good mood catch myth the right moment at the end he's also got the like but i mean also here's ten thousand talents of silver everybody everybody likes money now that's a really interesting play because it kind of hints that ten thousand talents of silver would be something that haman who's intimately familiar with xerxes finances kind of answer that haman thinks xerxes could use a little bit of jingle right now now this isn't a little bit of jingle i was over here scratching it out on a sheet of four five six seven so what are we talking i mean wow we're talking about two a quarter of a billion wait did i do that wrong no i think it's a quarter of a billion dollars equivalent of of what that would be right now xerxes had clearly drained the coffers on the whole the fair in greece looks like he still hadn't fully recovered from that financially here apparently we know we went and took on huge building projects we have literal inscriptions from the interim between the time he marries ester and the time that all of this stuff in ester three is happening we got literal inscriptions and palace complex there in susa so dude probably was a little bit over a barrel but here's the deal it's one thing for some dirty scabby politician to do the normal things the politicians do and enrich
